file_content.text: Lieutenant Drellik should be able to help you.
I'm looking for a ship called the Starrunner.
My lord! Truly an honor and a surprise.
I'm afraid no ships have landed on Hoth in ages, unless it's a crash--actually, the name "Starrunner" sounds familiar....
If I may ask, what do you need the ship for? You're here on Darth Thanaton's behalf, naturally.
I am my own master now, but you can be forgiven for thinking otherwise.
I don't work for Thanaton.
Right. Of course. I meant no offense, my lord.
That's none of your business.
Of course, my lord. It was rude of me to ask.
The Starrunner was, um, shipping artifacts that belonged to him.
Yes, of course.
Strange. The vessel I recall was a Republic ship.
Starrunner... blast. Your ship crashed years ago. It's buried under a few tonnes of snow by now.
Your best bet--no. Give me a few months to get a recovery team on it.
I'm afraid you may be dead in a few months. Is there a faster solution?
That's too long.
What don't I want to do?
Well, I mean, there is an Imperial Reclamation Service team you could take command of... if you wanted.
As long as I get the ship, I'm happy.
Do what you must.
My master, Darth Thanaton does not seem to be a patient man.
So, what? You'll just wait until Thanaton shows up to finish the job?
Of course, perhaps a few months isn't satisfactory for Darth Thanaton.
I hesitate to suggest it, but we do have a fully equipped Reclamation Service team in the field already.
It's just, the lieutenant in charge is a little odd. Too much time digging in tombs, you understand.
I only care that he can find the ship.
But is he any good?
Lieutenant Talos Drellik could find a piece of glass in the Tatooine desert, but he's... very particular about his work.
One moment you're seeking artifacts of unspeakable power, and the next you're flying halfway across the galaxy hunting ghosts.
Completely.
Well then, maybe you and Lieutenant Talos Drellik will get along after all.
Please, clarify.
They say Lieutenant Talos Drellik is very... particular about his work. Takes it extremely seriously.
I'm afraid I can't call Lieutenant Drellik; the weather on Hoth is bad for communications.
The team's way out in the wastes searching for some mythical Sith Temple, on Hoth of all places. Good luck, my lord.
Greetings, my lord.
